p: Simulated data from the 2040â€“2069 scenarios were generated using the delta method (Croley 2003; Fagherazzi et al. 2005) and expressed as hydrologic series. Water flows from the Great Lakes watershed were simulated by Croley ( 2003) and took into account precipitation, evapotranspiration, ice cover, soil humidity, and surface water runoff. The water flows were then adjusted according to projected climate differences (monthly deltas), and new predictive hydrologic series were developed, incorporating the influence of climate change scenarios on St. Lawrence River flows.
